document.masterDocTitle: An overview of the Onthophagini from the Arabian Peninsula (Coleoptera: Scarabaeoidea: Scarabaeidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–26. Onthophagini of Arabian Peninsula. 19,
Onthophagus bicolor Raffray, 1877
: OM (Dhofar) Wadi Ashawq; 20,
Onthophagus latipennis d’Orbigny, 1898
: OM (Dhofar) Al Mughsayl; 21,
Onthophagus trapezicornis d’Orbigny, 1902
: SA (Bahah) 5 km N Al Makhwah; 22,
Onthophagus brittoni Paulian, 1948
, ♂: SA (Asir) Abha, Raydah; 23,
Onthophagus brittoni Paulian, 1948
, ♀: SA (Asir) Abha, Raydah; 24,
Onthophagus brittoni Paulian, 1948
, paramera, lateral view, 25,
Onthophagus brittoni Paulian, 1948
, parameres, dorsal view; 26,
Onthophagus brittoni Paulian, 1948
, internal sac: accessory lamellae (above) and lamina copulatrix (below), ventral view. Photos by Gabriele Fiumi.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . First record for
Saudi Arabia
. In the original description ( Paulian 1948 ),
O. brittoni
has been placed in d’Orbigny (1913)’s 19 th group. Until now, the species was known only from the male holotype . The large number of specimens of both sexes collected in
Saudi Arabia
, allowed us to provide a redescription of the species (see Appendix).
